Sustainability Experience Utilities and Infrastructure Business Development Manager Ordnance Survey April 2015  – Present (5 months) Energy and Infrastructure 
 
Companies across the utilities sector rely on our geographic information (GI) to operate efficiently – GI can help your sector, be it gas and electricity, water, telecommunications, renewable energy, airports, ports or rail 
 
Location is a key component in the energy and infrastructure industry and geographic information is being used innovatively within geographical information systems (GIS) to provide business intelligence and integrate business processes. 
 
Combining your data with our detailed mapping data will benefit your organisation in a number of ways, saving you money and time. 
 
► Roll out smart meters ► Manage your assets effectively 
► Plan contingency measures ► Carry out critical infrastructure modelling 
► Improve civil protection ► Improve customer relations & billing 
► Improve scheduling & mobile field operations

Summary Over 15 years IT sales / business development experience working for both multinational corporations (IBM and Accenture), a leading UK managed services provider (Star) and HybridCluster - a game changing cloud enablement platform. During my career I have held a number of positions that have given me the opportunity to work with clients across several industry verticals within both SMB and Enterprise. This broad view of IT – and the role it plays supporting business strategy – allows me to take a holistic, consultative approach in dealing with my clients. I tend to work best with individuals who appreciate a long term relationship, honesty, trust – and individuals who like being challenged in their approach. Specialties: Aligning IT Strategy to Business Requirements.

Experience Cloud Sales Specialist IBM May 2015  – Present (4 months) London, United Kingdom After several years exploring life outside of IBM I have now returned and am working with clients to deliver innovation and value from our end2end Cloud portfolio (http://www.ibm.com/cloud-computing/uk/en/).  Sales Manager Currency Cloud July 2014  –  June 2015  (1 year) London, United Kingdom Currency Cloud deliver foreign exchange conversion and international payments as a cloud based web service, taking away the risk, uncertainty, excessive cost and complexity of currency from everyday transactions. 
 
Currency Cloud functionality includes: 
- Pricing in foreign currencies 
- Margin protection - rate secured at Point of Sale, not at Point of Conversion (later date) 
- Full FX rate transparency 
- Ability to apply FX mark-up 
- Net settlement 
- Swift and non-urgent global payments 
- Global, local bank account infrastructure 
- SaaS platform, delivered through a simple API or White Label 
 
The platform is aimed at servicing the thousands of firms that provide cross-border payments to their customers. For example brokerages, banks, PSPs, corporate service providers, e-commerce websites and payment software companies. VP of Sales HybridCluster April 2013  –  June 2014  (1 year 3 months) London, United Kingdom HybridCluster is a game-changer for anyone running web based cloud services who wish to dramatically improve system reliability, reduce operational costs and deliver SLA improvements. HybridCluster is a fully integrated suite of storage, replication and web clustering technologies that, in a single deployable package, provides bullet-proof high availability, intelligent auto-scaling, and integrated backup and recovery - all using low-cost local storage.  
Managing the unexpected becomes automated and fail proof - “Cloud how it’s meant to be”. 
 
Additional information can be found here: http://www.hybridcluster.com/ 
 
I am currently leading all sales & business development engagements with our clients across the globe and am interested to hear from prospective clients, partners and industry analysts. Head of Professional Services & 3rd Sector Star Technology Services Ltd May 2010  –  March 2013  (2 years 11 months) London, United Kingdom If you are a company looking to make sense of Cloud Computing, to give users access to computing they need when they want, to make best use of resources, to move from fixed to variable IT costs, to enable agility, flexibility and transformation – then Star could be your ideal partner. Star help organisations design, build, deploy and run private Cloud solutions through our two core capabilities:  
 
•	Cloud Strategy: Star work with a number of clients to help define where and how cloud can play a role. Our methodology starts with us reviewing the “as is” environment before understanding business and IT objectives/requirements – from this we build a cloud roadmap that defines appropriate cloud services (whether Star or other organisations) and when to deploy them (reducing risk and when most appropriate). This strategic work is of most benefit to organisations who recognise the value of “cloud” but don’t know where to start.  
 
•	Cloud Solutions Delivery Capability/Portfolio: Once an organisation has determined how and where Cloud can add value to the business, Star - and our partners in the Cloud Alliance - have a broad portfolio of solutions including managed hosting, unified communications, VOIP, hosted exchange, cloud applications and storage etc built in our UK Datacentres as “bespoke” private environments. As Star originated as a business only ISP we can also scope and deploy an appropriate WAN/MPLS network that aligns with your business and cloud objectives.

Summary After 25 years in IBM, in several roles and gaining a wide portfolio of knowledge and skills, I decided to take up a voluntary separation package which was effective on the 5th July 2013. 
My role in IBM was to use, and sometimes create, exceptional processes to show IBM's clients that IBM is a realistic partner for their international business. And, as importantly, to show IBM colleagues in the UK and Ireland (and in any other country), what is possible and what is achievable. Summary I have been working within sales, communication and client relationship management since 1997 with focus on long term relationship and networking building activities creating and adding value to my clients. Since 2001 I have been focused on solution based selling within the IT industry towards a variety of Public Sector, Industrial Sector & Distribution Sector clients. My focus has been at Business Relationship Management, identification and management of sales opportunities within services, products and solutions, leading sales activities within aligned teams towards clients, production of high value proposals and propositions as well as negotiation with my clients in sales closing activities.  
 
I’m an open minded, trustworthy, structured and well balanced character and work with pride as an individual as well as a team player. I’m known to work faster than average with focus on creating results for my clients without compromising on quality when delivering on promises and i like to act with accuracy and correctness both internally as well as externally.
